thread.title: LOCAL ROUNDUP: Habersham wins GICAA state volleyball crown
thread.title_full: LOCAL ROUNDUP: Habersham wins GICAA state volleyball crown | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: LOCAL ROUNDUP: Habersham wins GICAA state volleyball crown
text:
By Savannah Morning News
SUWANEE — The Habersham volleyball team swept four matches without losing a set and beat Heritage Christian in the championship match Saturday to win the Georgia Independent Christian Athletic Association Division II A state title.
The Patriots won by set scores of 25-15, 25-16, 25-11 in the title match with Heritage, after sweeping Westside Christian Academy, Heirway Christian and Westminster in their previous matches. Junior setter Ashlyn Burnsed had 30 assists, four digs, two aces and two kills and Sara Delk had 14 kills and nine digs for Habersham in the title match. Abbey McIntyre added 14 kills and five digs, while Allie Waller had nine digs and two kills. Peyton Burnsed was 17 of 17 serving with two aces and five digs.
“The girls were real excited,” Habersham coach Susan Barry said. “For a school in its third year of volleyball to win a state title is a real special thing. I thought we improved throughout the year and played with a lot of maturity. The effort was outstanding today, they were going after every ball and making some amazing digs and saves, it was a beautiful thing to see.”
COLLEGE
WOMEN’S SOCCER
ARMSTRONG 7,
GEORGIA SOUTHWESTERN 0
Armstrong State saw four school records fall in a 7-0 Peach Belt Conference win over Georgia Southwestern State.
The Pirates (10-3-2, 6-1-2 PBC) picked up their fifth win in a row and maintained the second-place standing in the PBC. Georgia Southwestern fell to 2-12 overall and 0-9 in the league.
Armstrong State set school records for total shots (73), shots on goal (35) and corner kicks (16) in the win over the Hurricanes — the previous record of 50 total shots was set last year against Georgia Southwestern State, while the previous record of 34 shots on goal was set against the Hurricanes in 2014. The previous record of 15 corner kicks was set vs. Anderson (S.C.) in 2006.
Junior Sarah Olin started the scoring for the Pirates by collecting two goals in less than a minute.
Also scoring were Marthan Trimback, Jenny Allen, Erin Berube (2), and Brooke Standard.
MEN’S SOCCER
GEORGIA SOUTHERN 1,
APPALACHIAN STATE 0
STATESBORO — A third minute goal was enough for Georgia Southern to take a 1-0 win over rival App State on Saturday night at Eagle Field. The Eagles (5-6-1, 2-1-0 SBC) are now second in the Sun Belt standings, tied with Georgia State and three points back of unbeaten Hartwick.
Georgia Southern visits NJIT on Friday night for the penultimate league match of the year.
Alfonso Ochoa got the only goal of the night from the center of the box when he struck a low cross into the net.
VOLLEYBALL
FRANCES MARION 3, ARMSTRONG 0
FLORENCE, S.C. - The Armstrong State volleyball team hit a season-low .116 in a 3-0 Peach Belt Conference loss at Francis Marion. Set scores were: 25-20, 25-16, 25-19.
The Pirates (12-7, 8-3 PBC) dropped their third out of their last four in Armstrong State’s current road swing, while Francis Marion improved to 13-10 overall and 6-6 in the Peach Belt with the win.
MEN’S X-COUNTRY
Armstrong seventh
GAINESVILLE — The Armstrong State University men’s cross country team finished seventh at the 2015 Peach Belt Conference Championships at the University of North Georgia.
The Pirates finished the meet with 166 points. UNC Pembroke captured the meet with 49 points, followed by Augusta University (64), Columbus State (77), Georgia College (130) and Flagler (146). Young Harris (154) finished sixth, just ahead of the Pirates,.
Sophomore Donald Shelton led ASU, finishing 10th with a time of 26:45.9 over the 8k course, earning All-Peach Belt honors.
ors. Sophomore Henning Schein finished 12th with a time of 26:50.3, also earning All-Peach Belt Conference honors.
